simulation_equations: k(T, [den]) = D_F * exp(-1/(R*T) * (ΔH_U2TS - T*ΔS_U2TS + ΔCp_U2TS*(T - T_0 - T*ln(T/T_0)) - m_U2TS*[den]))
ΔG(T, [den]) = ΔH - T*ΔS + ΔCp*(T - T_0 - T*ln(T/T_0)) - m*[den]
ΔG_TS(T, [den]) = ΔH_U2TS - T*ΔS_U2TS + ΔCp_U2TS*(T - T_0 - T*ln(T/T_0)) - m_U2TS*[den]
Stability-corrected: For constant ΔG(T, [den]) = ΔG_target, solve for [den](T) = (ΔH - T*ΔS + ΔCp*(T - T_0 - T*ln(T/T_0)) - ΔG_target)/m
ln(k_corrected) = ln(k(T, [den](T))) computed at each T where ΔG = ΔG_target
Slope of stability-corrected plot: d(ln(k))/d(1/T) at constant ΔG ≈ ΔE_a/R - (m_TS/m)*ΔG_target/R

constants_required.name: R
constants_required.description: Universal gas constant

constants_required.name: T_0
constants_required.description: Reference temperature for thermodynamic calculations

constants_required.name: ΔH_protein1
constants_required.description: Enthalpy change for unfolding of protein 1

constants_required.name: ΔS_protein1
constants_required.description: Entropy change for unfolding of protein 1

constants_required.name: ΔCp_protein1
constants_required.description: Heat capacity change for unfolding of protein 1

constants_required.name: m_protein1
constants_required.description: Denaturant dependence parameter for protein 1

constants_required.name: ΔH_U2TS_protein1
constants_required.description: Enthalpy change from unfolded to transition state for protein 1

constants_required.name: ΔS_U2TS_protein1
constants_required.description: Entropy change from unfolded to transition state for protein 1

constants_required.name: ΔCp_U2TS_protein1
constants_required.description: Heat capacity change from unfolded to transition state for protein 1

constants_required.name: m_U2TS_protein1
constants_required.description: Denaturant dependence from unfolded to transition state for protein 1

constants_required.name: D_F_protein1
constants_required.description: Pre-exponential factor for protein 1 folding rate

constants_required.name: ΔE_a_protein1
constants_required.description: Activation energy for configurational diffusion for protein 1

constants_required.name: ΔH_protein2
constants_required.description: Enthalpy change for unfolding of protein 2 (different stability)

constants_required.name: ΔS_protein2
constants_required.description: Entropy change for unfolding of protein 2

constants_required.name: ΔCp_protein2
constants_required.description: Heat capacity change for unfolding of protein 2

constants_required.name: m_protein2
constants_required.description: Denaturant dependence parameter for protein 2

constants_required.name: ΔH_U2TS_protein2
constants_required.description: Enthalpy change from unfolded to transition state for protein 2

constants_required.name: ΔS_U2TS_protein2
constants_required.description: Entropy change from unfolded to transition state for protein 2

constants_required.name: ΔCp_U2TS_protein2
constants_required.description: Heat capacity change from unfolded to transition state for protein 2

constants_required.name: m_U2TS_protein2
constants_required.description: Denaturant dependence from unfolded to transition state for protein 2

constants_required.name: D_F_protein2
constants_required.description: Pre-exponential factor for protein 2 folding rate

constants_required.name: ΔE_a_protein2
constants_required.description: Activation energy for configurational diffusion for protein 2

constants_required.name: ΔG_target
constants_required.description: Target stability for constant ΔG contours

variables_to_vary.name: protein_id
variables_to_vary.description: Identifier for different proteins with varying native state stabilities
variables_to_vary.range: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] representing proteins with different thermodynamic parameters

variables_to_vary.name: ΔE_a
variables_to_vary.description: Activation energy for configurational diffusion (hypothesis test parameter)

procedure_steps: Step 1: Initialize constants - Set R = 0.001987 kcal/(mol*K), T_0 = 298.15 K. Define thermodynamic parameters for 3-5 different proteins with varying native state stabilities (different ΔH, ΔS, ΔCp, m values). Each protein should have distinct stability at reference conditions but potentially share the same ΔE_a value to test universality.

Step 2: For each protein, compute the native state stability ΔG(T, [den]=0) at T_0 to verify they have different stabilities. Calculate ΔG(T, [den]) across a grid of temperatures (278-338 K, 20 points) and denaturant concentrations (0-8 M, 30 points) using the Gibbs-Helmholtz equation with heat capacity correction.

Step 3: For each protein and each target stability level ΔG_target (e.g., -2, 0, 2, 4, 6 kcal/mol), create constant stability contours by solving for [den](T) at each temperature such that ΔG(T, [den](T)) = ΔG_target. Use numerical root-finding (scipy.optimize.fsolve or brentq) to find [den] for each T.
Step 4: Calculate the transition state free energy ΔG_TS(T, [den]) for each protein at each (T, [den]) point using the transition state thermodynamic parameters (ΔH_U2TS, ΔS_U2TS, ΔCp_U2TS, m_U2TS).
Step 5: Compute folding rates k(T, [den]) for each protein using the full kinetic equation. For stability-corrected analysis, evaluate k(T, [den](T)) along each constant ΔG contour.

Step 6: Create stability-corrected Arrhenius plots by plotting ln(k) vs 1/T for each protein at each constant ΔG_target level. Perform linear regression to extract slopes for each protein-stability combination.

Step 7: Test hypothesis - Compare slopes across proteins: (a) If ΔE_a is universal, all proteins should yield similar slopes at the same ΔG_target level (within statistical error). (b) Calculate the effective ΔE_a from each slope using the relationship: slope ≈ ΔE_a/R - (m_TS/m)*ΔG_target/R. (c) Perform statistical analysis (mean, standard deviation, coefficient of variation) of ΔE_a values across proteins.

Step 8: Generate visualizations: (a) 2D contour plots of ΔG(T, [den]) for each protein showing constant stability lines. (b) Stability-corrected Arrhenius plots (ln(k) vs 1/T) for each protein at multiple ΔG_target values, overlaid on the same axes for comparison. (c) Bar plot or scatter plot showing extracted ΔE_a values for each protein with error bars. (d) Heatmap showing slope values as a function of protein_id and ΔG_target.

Step 9: Sensitivity analysis - Vary ΔE_a systematically for each protein (e.g., protein 1 with ΔE_a = 4 kcal/mol, protein 2 with ΔE_a = 6 kcal/mol) to demonstrate what non-universal behavior would look like in the stability-corrected plots.

Step 10: Statistical validation - Perform ANOVA or t-tests to determine if differences in extracted ΔE_a values across proteins are statistically significant. Calculate R² values for linear fits to assess quality of Arrhenius behavior.
expected_outcomes: If the hypothesis is correct (ΔE_a is universal), the simulation should reveal: (1) Stability-corrected Arrhenius plots (ln(k) vs 1/T at constant ΔG) for all proteins will be linear with similar slopes, regardless of their native state stabilities or specific thermodynamic parameters. (2) The extracted ΔE_a values from the slopes will cluster around a single value (within ~10-15% variation) across all proteins tested. (3) The slopes may vary slightly with ΔG_target due to the (m_TS/m)*ΔG_target/R term, but this variation should be consistent across proteins. (4) Proteins with very different native stabilities (e.g., ΔG at 25°C ranging from -10 to -2 kcal/mol) will still show convergent ΔE_a values. (5) The universality will be evident when plotting all proteins' stability-corrected data on the same axes - the lines should be parallel or nearly parallel. If the hypothesis is incorrect, different proteins will show significantly different slopes, indicating that ΔE_a depends on protein-specific features like sequence, topology, or structural complexity. The simulation will quantify this through statistical measures (coefficient of variation of ΔE_a across proteins should be <15% for universal behavior, >30% for protein-dependent behavior).
